top_categories.workout_context: Pony Xpress Gravel 160’s 160-mile distance demands power production deep into fatigue — the defining challenge of ultra-distance gravel.
Pony Xpress Gravel 160’s colorado mountains, ultra gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Pony Xpress Gravel 160 when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Pony Xpress Gravel 160’s 12,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Pony Xpress Gravel 160 rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Every session at Pony Xpress Gravel 160 intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Racing Pony Xpress Gravel 160 isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Pony Xpress Gravel 160. Make this intensity feel like home.
At 160 miles, Pony Xpress Gravel 160 rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
Pony Xpress Gravel 160’s colorado mountains gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Pony Xpress Gravel 160’s 12,000ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Pony Xpress Gravel 160 — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.

race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 160 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 160 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Pony Xpress Gravel 160. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Pony Xpress Gravel 160 demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride colorado mountains gravel at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: colorado mountains, ultra gravel, high altitude. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 160 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Gravel Specific, and Over Under to prepare you for 160 miles of colorado mountains gravel in Trinidad, CO.
